header_summary: Tom Briar is updating his code to align with the documentation and plans to add a compressrawtransaction RPC endpoint that includes a limit on uncompressed TxId. ZmnSCPxj suggests focusing on Lightning as a scaling solution instead of sidechains and proposes using a federated sidechain for developing features. Nick Farrow discusses a draft scheme for blinding and FROST compatibility, emphasizing the need for security assessment. David Stainton suggests improving the performance of the Sphinx cryptographic packet format by reducing public key operations and combining different KEMs. Atomic Mr Nuclear clarifies the permissionless nature of Bitcoin and the permissioned nature of the Lightning channel. Antoine Riard discusses defending against a botnet and suggests investigating anonymous credentials as a technique. They are working on a Rust implementation for the Lightning Network.

recent_posts.title: Compressed Bitcoin Transactions
recent_posts.summary:
- Tom is updating the code to match the documentation, which will be done this week.
- The safe number of blocks is estimated to be 100, including spending coin base transactions.
- Tom adds a compressrawtransaction RPC endpoint in the PR and plans to update the documentation.

recent_posts.title: Sentinel Chains: A Novel Two-Way Peg
recent_posts.summary:
- The sender expresses initial interest in sidechains as a scaling solution for blockchains.
- They turn their attention to Lightning as a non-blockchain mechanism for scaling blockchains.
- The sender suggests a federated sidechain and an old idea called "mainstake" as alternatives.

recent_posts.title: Private Collaborative Custody with FROST
recent_posts.summary:
- The email discusses a draft scheme that explains blinding and FROST compatibility.
- The scheme involves obtaining a public nonce, constructing an aggregate nonce, and calculating a challenge.
- Security measures are emphasized, such as blinding the challenge and conducting sequential signing sessions.

recent_posts.title: faster NIKE Sphinx or more secure KEM Sphinx
recent_posts.summary:
- David Stainton raises concerns about Sphinx's performance, suggesting improvements by eliminating certain operations.
- He suggests combining NIKE adapted KEM with a Post Quantum KEM like Kyber1024.
- David discusses bandwidth overhead and references a paper on security preserving KEM combiners.

recent_posts.title: Nucleus: Capital-efficient multipeer Lightning payment channels
recent_posts.summary:
- The Bitcoin blockchain is permissionless, but the Lightning channel is fully permissioned.
- Participants in the Lightning channel require authorization from each other.
- The permissioned system provides protection against Sybil attacks and includes trustworthy participants.

recent_posts.title: TOR enabled dynamic Proof of Work defense for onion services
recent_posts.summary:
- Antoine discusses defending against a botnet and suggests investigating anonymous credentials.
- During the Zurich lightning event, the bip154 idea was discussed but discarded.
- Antoine is implementing Staking Credentials using elliptic curve-based cryptosystems for Lightning Network.

active_posts.title: Blinded 2-party Musig2
active_posts.summary:
- We are implementing a version of 2-of-2 Schnorr Musig2 for statechains.
- The server will be fully 'blinded' and will not learn the aggregate public key or signature.
- The security relies on trusting the statechain server to report the number of partial signatures.

active_posts.title: Ark: An Alternative Privacy-preserving Second Layer Solution
active_posts.summary:
- A new second-layer protocol called Ark has been released as an alternative to Lightning.
- Ark utilizes virtual UTXOs to enable off-chain, anonymous payments and requires spending within four weeks.
- Users can acquire vTXOs or lift their on-chain UTXOs, and ASPs provide liquidity and charge fees.

active_posts.title: Concrete MATT opcodes
active_posts.summary:
- Salvatore Ingala has presented a complete proposal for the core opcodes of MATT.
- The proposal includes a revised and improved implementation in the bitcoin-inquisition repo fork.
- The new opcode, OP_CHECKCONTRACTVERIFY, replaces previous opcodes and offers enhanced functionality.

active_posts.title: Resumable channels using OP_CHECKSIGFROMSTACK
active_posts.summary:
- The proposal introduces a new type of channel funding transaction using OP_CAT and OP_CHECKSIGFROMSTACK.
- During channel reestablishment, Bob sends Alice her latest state using an extra field.
- Fraud proofs are introduced to detect revoked states and allow unilateral spending.

active_posts.title: LN Summit 2024 Organization
active_posts.summary:
- Antoine Riard proposes organizing the LN Summit in Africa in June 2024.
- Africa's cultural richness, fragmented financial systems, and growing Lightning developers make it an ideal location.
- Antoine invites objections or feedback and suggests surveying suitable countries for hosting the summit.

active_posts.title: Jamming Mitigation Dry Run
active_posts.summary:
- The plan discussed at the summit will involve a "dry run" of HTLC endorsement and local reputation tracking.
- The plan includes collecting forwarding data, propagating an experimental TLV, and implementing local reputation algorithms.
- Node operators are encouraged to participate in data collection and ask for assistance if needed.
